Source code for tests.test_generator

from pyfractal import generator




[docs]
def test_sequence():
    """Tests the four first values generated by function sequence() for one input.
    """
    epsilon = 0.00001
    true_values = [(3+2j), (7+12j), (-93+168j), (-19573-31248j)]
    test_values = generator.sequence(3+2j, 2)
    for n in range(4):
        assert abs(next(test_values)-true_values[n]) < epsilon






[docs]
def test_mandelbrot_sequence():
    """Tests the four first values generated by function mandelbrot_sequence() for one input.
    """
    epsilon = 0.00001
    true_values = [(0), (0.1+0.1j), (0.1+0.12j), (0.0956+0.124j)]
    test_values = generator.mandelbrot_sequence(0.1+0.1j)
    for n in range(4):
        assert abs(next(test_values) - true_values[n]) < epsilon






[docs]
def test_julia_sequence():
    """Tests the four first values generated by function julia_sequence() for one input.
    """
    epsilon = 0.000000001
    true_values = [(0.1j), (0.29+0.5j), (0.1341+0.79j),
                   (-0.30611719+0.711878j)]
    test_values = generator.julia_sequence(0.1j, 0.3 + 0.5j)
    for n in range(4):
        assert abs(next(test_values) - true_values[n]) < epsilon
